content.description: Crux is getting over the bulge at the bottom with, no protection, to a diagonal crack. This leads to the main crack which you follow to the top.
content.location: Starts on the far right side of the face right before a vegetated ramp. To descend follow the ridge to the east, down climb descent gully.

content.description:
Easy trad lead with a heady problem after the prominent bulge encouraging a run out. Top out includes a nice boulder that can be slung for a top rope. 

  Crux is managing rope drag due to bushes after the bulge. Limited protection after passing the bulge.
content.protection: Standard trad rack. Can sling a boulder at the top for a top rope.
content.location: Left of Baklava. Obvious bulge with horizontal cracks, small ledge system, and a large number of bushes.

content.description: Right angling crack, fun finish on short exposed tower on top
content.location: Located in the middle of the face. The are two cracks that intersect about half way up the cliff. Baklava is the left one.

content.description: The NW Face is mostly lower angle and has lots of trad potential. The far left side (when looking at the face) has some steeper sections. It's in the shade till the afternoon.
